webserver

Class EntityHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle
      • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle
        • org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
          • webserver.EntityHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Container, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectionHandler, CourseHandler, ExerciseHandler

    public abstract class EntityHandler
extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
    An entity handler will present CRUD actions for the respective entity that are used by the website interface.

          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
            throws java.io.IOException

        java.io.IOException

      • doAction

        protected abstract java.lang.String doAction(java.lang.String target,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                                      throws BadRequestException,
                                             InternalActionErrorException
        Selects the appropriate action depending on the target and runs it. It then returns the output of the action (normally JSON). The return can be directly written to the response text.
        Parameters:
        target - the target as in Handler.handle(String, Request, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)
        request - the request as in Handler.handle(String, Request, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)
        Returns:
        the output of the action
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if something goes wrong due to a bad request or the requested action does not exist
        InternalActionErrorException - if something else goes wrong (e.g. could not write to file)

      • parseName

        protected java.lang.String parseName(java.lang.String parameter,
                         java.lang.String nameType)
                              throws BadRequestException
        Parses a given parameter from a request (or any other string) to a valid name.
        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter to parse to a name
        nameType - defines the type of the name: sshusername, username, name
        Returns:
        a valid name
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the parameter does not represent a valid name

      • parseDateTime

        protected java.util.Date parseDateTime(java.lang.String parameter)
                                throws BadRequestException
        Parses a given parameter from a request (or any other string) to a valid date-time (Date). The parameter has to be formatted like in DATE_TIME_FORMAT
        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter to parse to a date-time
        Returns:
        a valid Date
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the parameter does not represent a valid date

      • parseTimePeriod

        protected long parseTimePeriod(java.lang.String parameter)
                        throws BadRequestException
        Parses a given parameter from a request (or any other string) to a valid time period. The parameter has to be formatted like in TIME_FORMAT
        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter to parse to a period
        Returns:
        a valid duration in milliseconds
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the parameter does not represent a valid period

        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter to parse to a connection ID
        Returns:
        a valid ID
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the parameter does not represent a valid ID

      • parseId

        protected int parseId(java.lang.String parameter,
          java.lang.String entityName)
               throws BadRequestException
        Parses a given parameter from a request (or any other string) to a valid ID.
        Parameters:
        parameter - the parameter to parse to an ID
        entityName - a string representing the name of an entity class (e.g. "exercise" for Exercise), which is here solely used for the error message
        Returns:
        a valid ID
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the parameter does not represent a valid ID

      • writeSubmittedFile

        protected void writeSubmittedFile(javax.servlet.http.Part part,
                      java.nio.file.Path outputDirectory)
                           throws BadRequestException,
                                  InternalActionErrorException
        This method writes a submitted file of a multipart request to its destination.
        Parameters:
        part - the part with the submitted file in it
        outputDirectory - the directory to put the file into
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the submitted file is not valid
        InternalActionErrorException - if the file could not be written or the path

      • optionalWriteSubmittedFile

        protected void optionalWriteSubmittedFile(javax.servlet.http.Part part,
                              java.nio.file.Path outputDirectory)
                                   throws BadRequestException,
                                          InternalActionErrorException
        This method writes a submitted file of a multipart request to its destination. If the file does not exist, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        part - the part with the submitted file in it
        outputDirectory - the directory to put the file into
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the submitted file is not valid
        InternalActionErrorException - if the file could not be written or the path
